name: Rio Dolphin Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a pleasant surprise this place was. Very kitschy decor, which added to the fun easy-going nature of the inn. John and Nina were amazing from the moment we met them. Showing us around the city, giving us tips and setting up tours. Providing a unique and authentic perspective of Rio.
reviews.title: Sorry Dos Equis guy, John is the most interesting man in the World

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is dead-centre between Ipanema Beach & Copacabana Beach and we couldn't have picked a better spot for our stay in Rio!
reviews.title: Mindblowing city & little inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've been meaning to write this review for a while now...we went on a trip to Rio in Feb 2010 during the Carnival season. My husband and I did not know anyone in Rio but having met John and Nina felt like having local friends who helped guide us ...
reviews.title: what John and Nina dont know about Rio isnt worth knowing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the location of the Inn - right between Copacabana & Ipanema - the decor of the living room/kitchen, bathroom are amazing!!!
reviews.title: Worth every penny,best location and owners in Rio!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there for 8 nights and i still kept discovering little things that pop up from everywhere - John is a genius in decorating it!!!
reviews.title: Value for money. Priceless, personalized, attention. Play it local.
The place to stay in Rio!
reviews.text: I have been meaning to write this review for the last couple of weeks. We just recently came back from South American and the Rio Dolphin Inn was definitely a highlight in terms of places we stayed. John and Nina were very welcoming upon our arrival, offering fresh juices and chocolates. John gave us a tour of the city and amazing tips during our short stay. His knowledge of Rio is a definite bonus and I feel we would have missed a lot if we didn't have his guidance. The cafe he suggests is the best and we even bumped into him and the dogs a few times around town while we were there. The Rio Dolphin Inn offers an alternative from your typical hotel and a welcome change for those of you looking for something different. The house is a true reflection of the laid back, eclectic lifestyle John and Nina live. Would definitely return!

I loved staying in Rio Dolphin Inn because of the convenient location, 5 minute walk to Ipanema beach and of course John and Nina. They were simply wonderful. Nina was constantly giving us suggestions on things to do and also how to navigate the city. Topping it all, her safety tips were wonderful.
reviews.title: ONE OF THE BEST PLACES I'VE STAYED

reviews.text: We read the past reviews prior to reserving a spot at Cozy Corner. They were responsive to our questions prior to booking and after the reservation was made. Upon arrival, they served us fruit juices, chocolate. I agree with the past reviews when they stated that it was like meeting up with old friends! They were so sweet because they places several large bottles of water and juice in the refridgerator for us! We were not charged for drinking the water. Also.. they were thoughtful in that they left sunblock for us too!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I go back to Rio Dolpin Inn, I would definitely want to stay here again. The location is wonderful, it's surrounded by multiple restaurants, juice stores. The subway station (General Osorio) and bus station is a 7 minute walk. Citibank, HSBC and Bank of Brazil are nearby. Also.. this is a pretty safe area as this in the area between Ipanema and Copacabana. There is also a 24 hour doorman who will buzz us in to the building!
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay in Rio

reviews.text: We loved the personal tour of the neighbourhood by John! He is full of information and helpfull in organising tours. Great location and we would definatelly come back!
reviews.title: John and Nina were great and extremely...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first thing to say about our stay at the Cosy Corner was that John & Nina were brilliant hosts! They are very knowledgeable and super helpful. It really felt like nothing was too much trouble. Before we arrived they offered to arrange transfers from the airport and also to help plan our trip if needed. The Cosy Corner is a separate flat to the actual Dolphin Inn which has it's own bathroom (including a small tub), air conditioning, ceiling fan, reasonable sized flat screen TV with cable, wifi internet, a small CD player and also a grill, bar sized fridge and small bench top cooker. The flat is in a really convenient location just minutes walk from the Metro and either Ipanema or Cococabana Beaches not to mention plenty of fantastic restaurants and places to drink. For this convenience, you do have to be prepared to accept that you are in a vibrant area and there is inevitably some noise.
reviews.title: Fantastic location; great hosts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived the fridge was stocked with several large bottles of water, cans of soft drink, juice and a jar of chocolates on the bench. This was a fantastic touch and made all the difference when we arrived tired from our travels and in need of a cold drink and nice treat of local chocolates!
reviews.title: I WISH these owners had properties all over the world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PLACES TO EAT CLOSE BY
reviews.title: Excellent accommodation choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ask John and Nina to point you in the direction of their favourite breakfast place (Cafeina - Rue Farme Amoedo 43). They took us there one morning and it was soooo good we went back the next day! Another great place for breakfast is The Gringo Cafe (Rue Barao de Torre 240) And you must try a visit to a Churrascaria (traditional steak/BBQ) We tried two in Impanema. Porcao was the first, which was amazing however slightly expensive. We discovered a second place called Churrascaria Carretao, Rue Visconde de Piraja 112 which was equally as good on choice and quality but not as expensive.
reviews.title: Quaint little apt, Great location, very helpful hosts! Perfect for 2 young travelers!

reviews.text: Staying at the Rio Dolphin Inn is like visiting best friends from College years later. John & Nina are more than simple innkeepers, they are enthusiastic global citizens who are completely dedicated to ensuring you have a positive experience of Ipanema beach.
reviews.title: Overall, Rio Dolphin Inn is a great place for a visit to Rio.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can not say enough positive things about staying at the Rio Dolphin Inn. Staying at the Rio Dolphin Inn with John really does feel like staying with an old friend in terms of familiarity and feeling at home. However, it is actually much better than that.
reviews.title: Like staying with an old friend if your friends were actually cool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we flew in and were picked up by our airport transport (arranged through John), during our ride John called the driver to check in on us and we chatted with him while in the terminal. My friends always forget to pick me up from the airport. Point, John.
reviews.title: Wonderful host, great location

reviews.text: When we arrived at the wonderful inn, John introduced us to a fridge stocked with coconut water, iced mate, and more fresh fruit and chocolate then we can eat in a month. When I go to a friends house, their fridge is empty and I end up eating dried spaghetti out of the cabinet. Point, John.
reviews.title: Great location, wonderful hosts
Great hosts, great location
reviews.text: I could continue on and on about how John is better than my friends, but the point is that from the moment you get there John is great about making you feel at home, while giving you amenities that you would expect from a great hotel. The rooms are clean, the wifi always worked, and John is a fountain of information about what to do and where to go, and always calls and makes booking for you so you don't have to deal with any of the logistics.

He also goes above and beyond to make your stay special. We were there for New Years and he bought us flowers so we could make the traditional sea offering that Rio residents would make. He also gave us champagne. Additionally, another person staying there at the same time as us had a birthday during his stay and he bought a cake and threw a mini-party for him during our stay.
reviews.title: our 2nd home.

aka: Rio Dolphin Hotel Rio De Janeiro
description: The Rio Dolphin Inn is a small but quality guest house in Rio's prime location: between Copacabana and Ipanema beaches. We are rated five stars by TripAdvisor (100 reviews) and in 2012 and 2013 received their prestigious Certificate of Excellence Award. Our specialty is giving you the best quality and service with all the help you need to get the most out of your stay in Rio. Our location cannot be beat: we are surrounded by the city's best beaches, restaurants, shops and attractions and the Ipanema subway, just a block away. We offer you the hospitality and warmth of a cozy home with the comforts of a nice hotel, such as AC, ceiling fan, Wifi, cable TV, quality showers, beds and pillows. You can find cheaper places to stay, and you can certainly find more expensive places to stay, but we honestly don't think you will find a better place to fulfill your Rio dreams.
